verbs.description: rusticate (third-person singular simple present rusticates, present participle rusticating, simple past and past participle rusticated)

entries.meaning: (transitive, Oxbridge, Durham University) To be suspended or expelled temporarily from the university, either compulsorily or voluntarily.
examples: I was very unwell, so I had to rusticate for a year.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To construct in a manner so as to produce jagged or heavily textured surfaces.
(transitive) To compel to live in or to send to the countryside; to cause to become rustic.
(intransitive) To go to reside in the country.
